document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: FN: to move making a dull explosive sound as if by a laboring engine

sentence.text: Up from the river chugs a little blue train .

A dredge chugging around the Cornish coastline will suck up , with equipment resembling a giant vacuum cleaner , the mining waste that previous generations of tin miners have allowed to flow out to sea in streams and rivers .
By the time he had got clear of the dog fight the Albatros was a couple of hundred yards away , closing on the two-seater as it chugged westwards against the implacable wind .
Chugging across the dark river with these two fellers in the outboard , I relax with them .

As the train left the suburbs of Glasgow I settled into my very comfortable corner seat to enjoy the views as the hills and lochs passed slowly by , and the train chugged steadily along the West Highland Line .
Only some sailors in blue jerseys who appeared as the Shirley chugged alongside the boarding pontoon .
The snow was coming down in thick flakes , adding to the unreal appearance as they chugged slowly from one bank to the other , and she was delighted that they stopped at every single stop .
Not more than half an hour had passed when a little grey tractor chugged into the car park .
THE Australian Rolls Royce that purred out of Twickenham 12 months ago , the World Cup secured in its boot , chugs into Cardiff Arms Park tomorrow badly in need of a two-year service .
With some trepidation I went with him with the trusty Seagull Outboard chugging manfully over the huge swell .
The weather was fine , and they rode on the open top deck , from where one had a-lofty view of sooty old London and felt high above the Thames as the vehicle chugged over Westminster Bridge .
We chugged past the famous Dawlish Warren , a sandy spit , rich in wildlife , which juts out across the mouth of the Exe .
` I do n't know how those people can read newspapers when they 're chugging past scenery like this ! "
For a honeymoon with an unhurried pace why not chug through the serene Victorian waterways of England on a 60 canal barge ?
This line is to be reopened soon for tourists and again the steam-trains will chug to Aqaba on the coast .
Thinking that was a dig at female priorities , she smiled but said nothing as they chugged slowly to a small jetty .
At that moment , there came a phut-phut-phut from the drive below as a tiny Fiat Topolino chugged towards the house .
Quickly she put together a few sandwiches and , suitably dressed for walking , waited impatiently as they chugged slowly towards their planned point of departure .
As the boat chugs under the low arched bridges , the driver catalogues in Dutch , French , German and English the exhibits in this living museum .
It was a beautiful sunny morning , and at eleven o'clock , after I had done a quick surgery , we chugged quietly out of the harbour , with Lucy at the controls .
Peons were even brought in sustain the illusion by prodding at the land , and a bulldozer chugged about .
With Williamson at the wheel the boat chugged along merrily while the rest of us lolled on deck-chairs with plenty of laughter and good cheer .
Church bells sounded across the city and as they crossed the road they could see two brightly painted barges chugging away up the canal beneath the overhanging willows .
Most of the apartments face over the harbour and you can sit on your balcony and watch the fishing boats chug in and out of the harbour .
The train chugged on northwards , further and further away from the enemy , until it finally came to a halt at Waverley station in Edinburgh .
Finally , on a bright sunny morning , our train chugged along the wide expanse of the Fraser River and Vancouver Inlet to that great city itself .
The car was chugging along the Promenade des Anglais , a boulevard lined with splendid palm-trees .

A cabin cruiser was chugging down the wide brown river towards that little harbour I 'd seen , and over the other side the bank was so steep that the rows of terraced houses were leaning over each other to get a view .

As the car chugged down the M1 motorway I stopped cursing my bad luck and thought of how we could have made the first descent if only we had concentrated on the job in hand and not got the press involved or told so many people all about our daring endeavour .
They chugged down river from the pier towards the entrance to the tunnel .
In response to a frantic waving of arms a few minutes later , I opened up our trusty Seagull motor and chugged round the harbour arm to brave the swell .
The train chugged down to the mountain-ringed plains where sheep and alpaca were herded by bowler-hatted women .

As the train chugged slowly forward , stopping inexplicably for long periods and even occasionally travelling backwards , Ludovico enjoyed the luxury of being able to examine his travelling companion openly while she slept .

The rest of the year , life goes on at its accustomed pace : rickety machines chugging in two - man factories , children in school uniforms being ferried home to houseboats , and the old fishermen stirring shrimp paste .
